ground_truth: The boys are scared as they watch the creature hold Woodward tight, lift him, and its tentacles suddenly thrust into his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe stands and looks intently at the screen. Just then, a muffled shatter-crash occurs, and suddenly, boom, the doors burst open with armed commandos. Donny gets stoned in his car and doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the military coming in. In the locker hallway, the boys are handcuffed and scared as they are led out by armed soldiers. Nelec moves to them while Overmyer checks their pockets, and Nelec takes Cary's backpack, opens it, and pulls out some fireworks. Joe is terrified as Overmyer pulls from Joe's pocket a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's necklace, dropping everything but the necklace. Joe reacts panicked and is on the verge of tears as Overmyer pockets the necklace. The terrified boys are ushered away and put onto the bus. Boom down to Donny's car in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only audience to this; Donny, sunk deep in his seat, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the bus drives away, his stoned mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining military, Donny scrambles for his CB, turns to channel 9, grabs the mike, and speaks quietly, frantic. Jack moves fast through the crowded evac area. Preston reads Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine when suddenly Jack is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as Nelec moves back; we push in on Overmyer, who sits near the front, putting on his dark gloves. Nelec sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, 40, sits too. We push past them toward the four boys, sitting cuffed and seat-belted behind the dirty, wired safety glass, all looking toward us, terrified. Glass shatters as the entire bus is rocked, Charles screams, hurt, and at the front of the bus, Nelec falls and hits a bench. The bus was hit so hard it rides for a moment only on its wheels. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the bus slams back onto the road loudly and a tire blows. The kids panic as the hobbled bus still drives. We push in on Cary, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified. Charles scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam! The bus is slammed so hard that windows shatter, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts removed, land on Joe and Martin. The three soldiers hit the window-floor painfully, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt. Nelec rises, scared but pissed. The rear wheels of the bus scream in rotation as we countermove with the creature as it comes around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The lads are frightened as they observe the being grip Woodward firmly, elevate him, and its appendages suddenly drive into his nostrils, ears, and mouth. Joe rises and gazes intently at the display. Just then, a muted smash-crash transpires, and suddenly, boom, the entrances explode open with armed operatives. Donny gets high in his vehicle and doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the military arriving. In the locker corridor, the lads are shackled and frightened as they are led out by armed troops. Nelec advances to them while Overmyer inspects their pockets, and Nelec takes Cary's knapsack, opens it, and retrieves some pyrotechnics. Joe is terrified as Overmyer pulls from Joe's pocket a pair of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's pendant, dropping everything but the pendant. Joe reacts panicked and is on the verge of tears as Overmyer pockets the pendant. The terrified lads are ushered away and placed onto the coach. Boom down to Donny's vehicle in the forefront, where we realize that we haven't been the only audience to this; Donny, sunk deep in his seat, concealing, watches wide-eyed as the coach drives away, his high mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining military, Donny scrambles for his CB, turns to channel 9, grabs the microphone, and speaks softly, frantic. Jack moves swiftly through the crowded evac area. Preston peruses Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine when suddenly Jack is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as Nelec moves back; we push in on Overmyer, who sits near the front, putting on his dark mittens. Nelec sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the coach where another airman, Hernandez, 40, sits too. We push past them toward the four lads, sitting shackled and seat-belted behind the grimy, wired safety pane, all looking toward us, terrified. Pane shatters as the entire coach is rocked, Charles yells, hurt, and at the front of the coach, Nelec falls and strikes a bench. The coach was struck so hard it rides for a moment only on its wheels. The military chauffeur struggles with the wheel as the coach slams back onto the road loudly and a tire bursts. The kids panic as the crippled coach still drives. We push in on Cary, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified. Charles scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam! The coach is slammed so hard that panes shatter, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts removed, land on Joe and Martin. The three soldiers hit the window-floor painfully, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt. Nelec rises, scared but furious. The rear wheels of the coach scream in rotation as we countermove with the being as it arrives around the other side, ascends onto the exposed side, made of metal and pane.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The boys are scared as Woodward is held tight by the creature, lifted, and its tentacles are suddenly thrust into his nose, ears, and mouth. The screen is looked at intently by Joe. Just then, a muffled shatter-crash is heard, and suddenly, boom, armed commandos burst open the doors. Donny, stoned in his car, doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the military coming in. In the locker hallway, armed soldiers lead the boys, handcuffed and scared, out. The boys are approached by Nelec while their pockets are checked by Overmyer, and Cary's backpack is taken by Nelec, opened, and some fireworks are pulled out. Joe is terrified as a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's necklace are pulled from Joe's pocket by Overmyer, and everything but the necklace is dropped. The panicked Joe reacts, on the verge of tears, as the necklace is pocketed by Overmyer. The terrified boys are ushered away and put onto the bus. Boom down to Donny's car in the foreground, where it is realized by us that we haven't been the only audience to this; Donny, sunk deep in his seat, hides, watching wide-eyed as the bus drives away, his stoned mind races. The CB is scrambled for by Donny, staying hidden from the remaining military; he turns to channel 9, grabs the mike, and speaks quietly, frantic. Jack fast moves through the crowded evac area. Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine is read by Preston when suddenly Jack is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as Nelec moves back; Overmyer is pushed in on, who sits near the front, putting on his dark gloves. Nelec sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, 40, also sits. We push past them toward the four boys, sitting cuffed and seat-belted behind the dirty, wired safety glass, all looking toward us, terrified. Glass shatters as the entire bus is rocked, Charles screams, hurt, and at the front of the bus, a bench is hit by Nelec as he falls. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the bus is slammed back onto the road loudly and a tire is blown. The kids panic as the bus still drives, hobbled. Cary is pushed in on, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified. The seatbelt is scrambled to be unlatched by Charles. Baaam! The windows are shattered as the bus is slammed so hard, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts removed, land on Joe and Martin. The window-floor is hit painfully by the three soldiers, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt. Nelec rises, scared but pissed. The rear wheels of the bus scream in rotation as we countermove with the creature as it comes around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The boys watch in fear as the creature grips Woodward, thrusting its tentacles into his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe watches the screen intently. Suddenly, a crash occurs, and armed commandos burst in. Donny is stoned in his car, oblivious to the military behind him. In the hallway, the boys are handcuffed and led away by soldiers. Nelec searches them, finding fireworks in Cary's backpack. Overmyer takes coins, gum, and Joe's mother's necklace, keeping the necklace. Joe is panicked. The boys are put on a bus. Donny, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the bus departs. He grabs his CB and speaks urgently. Jack rushes through the evac area, grabbing Preston. Nelec and Overmyer are on the bus with airman Hernandez. The bus rocks violently, glass shattering, as Nelec falls. The military driver struggles as a tire blows. The kids panic while Cary is terrified. Charles unbuckles his seatbelt, and the bus is slammed again, throwing the boys and soldiers painfully. Nelec rises, scared and angry. The creature appears and climbs the exposed metal and windows side of the bus.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The boys watch in terror as the creature grabs Woodward, its tentacles invading his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe stares at the screen. Suddenly, armed commandos burst in. Donny, stoned in his car, misses the military's approach. In the hallway, the boys, terrified, are handcuffed and led by soldiers. Nelec arrives, and Overmyer searches their pockets, finding fireworks in Cary's backpack and Joe's mother's necklace, which he keeps. The boys, panicked, are put on a bus. Donny, hiding, watches wide-eyed and grabs his CB radio to speak frantically. In a crowded evac area, Jack pulls Preston away. Nelec and Overmyer sit at the front of the bus as we see the boys, cuffed, looking terrified. Glass shatters as the bus is rocked, sending Nelec crashing. The bus rides on its wheels, then slams back onto the road, blowing a tire. The kids panic in the hobbled bus. Cary looks terrified, and Charles unbuckles his seatbelt just as the bus slams hard, shattering windows. Charles and Cary land on Joe and Martin. The soldiers hit the floor, Hernandez injured. Nelec stands, scared and angry. The creature climbs onto the exposed side of the bus.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the tense scene unfolds, the boys find themselves consumed by fear as they watch with wide, anxious eyes. Before them, the creature has taken hold of Woodward in a tight grip, lifting him effortlessly. In a horrifying moment, tentacles suddenly and forcefully thrust into Woodward's nose, ears, and mouth, leaving the boys absolutely terrified. Joe, standing firm and focused, directs his intense gaze at the screen in front of him. Abruptly, the silence is shattered by a muffled crashing sound, and in an instant, a loud boom resonates as the doors fly open, revealing armed commandos bursting into the scene. Meanwhile, Donny, lost in the haze of his own world, sits in his car, stoned, utterly oblivious to the distant movement behind him, which is the stealthy approach of the military forces.

In the locker-filled hallway, the boys, shackled and frightened, are escorted out by armed soldiers. Nelec approaches them as Overmyer diligently searches their pockets. As Nelec seizes Cary's backpack, he unzips it and reveals a stash of fireworks hidden within. Joe, trembling with terror, watches as Overmyer retrieves a few coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum chewing gum, and his precious mother's necklace from his pocket, carelessly dropping everything except the necklace. Joe's composure shatters, and he nears tears as he sees Overmyer pocket the cherished necklace. The terrified boys are hurriedly ushered away, forced onto the waiting bus.

The focus shifts down to Donny's car in the foreground. It becomes clear that we have not been alone in witnessing this dramatic scene unfold; Donny, sinking deeper into his seat in an attempt to remain hidden, watches with wide, astonished eyes as the bus drives away. His stoned mind races, and realizing the urgency, he crouches low, scrambling for his CB radio. Turning to channel 9, he grips the microphone tightly and speaks in a quiet, frantic whisper. Meanwhile, Jack is moving swiftly through the chaotic din of the crowded evacuation area, preoccupied. Preston, immersed in his reading of Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine, is abruptly pulled from his focus when Jack unexpectedly arrives in front of him, pulling him up with a swift motion.

The scene transitions as Nelec retreats, and we focus closely on Overmyer, who sits near the front of the bus, methodically putting on his dark gloves with a sense of impending purpose. Nelec takes a seat, drawing our viewpoint towards the bus's rear, where another airman, Hernandez, aged 40, sits as well. Our gaze navigates past them, zeroing in on the four boys, sitting restrained by both handcuffs and seat belts, peering through the dirty, wired safety glass with sheer terror in their eyes, gazing directly at us.

Suddenly, the tension peaks as glass violently shatters, and the entire bus is jolted, sending Charles into a scream, pained and startled. At the front, Nelec is thrown forward and collides with a bench. The impact is so powerful that the bus momentarily balances precariously only on its wheels. The military driver, faced with a struggle to control the steering wheel, is powerless as the bus crashes back onto the road with a loud thud, causing a tire to blow out. The kids are engulfed in panic as the damaged bus continues to move. We zoom in on Cary, capturing a close-up of his face, eyes wide with terror, as he looks past the camera. Charles, in a desperate scramble, fights to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam! The bus endures another violent impact, so forceful that windows shatter, propelling Charles and Cary, now free from their seatbelts, to crash into Joe and Martin. The three soldiers are slammed against the window-floor painfully, with Hernandez hitting so hard that he is instantly injured. Nelec, rising from the chaos, is both scared and visibly angry. The rear wheels of the bus scream as they spin, and we countermove with the creature, stealthily circling around the other side, climbing with deliberate intent onto the exposed metal and glass side of the bus.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As the intensely dramatic scene unfolds, the young boys find themselves completely consumed by a paralyzing fear, watching with wide, anxious eyes filled with dread. Right before them, the terrifying creature has taken hold of Woodward in a grip so tight it seems unbreakable, lifting him with an effortless strength that defies belief. In a horrifying and ghastly moment, tentacles suddenly and forcefully thrust into Woodward's nose, ears, and mouth, a sight so dreadful that it leaves the boys absolutely terrified beyond words. Joe, standing firm and focused despite the chaos, directs his intense gaze at the screen that is positioned in front of him. Abruptly, the silence is shattered by a muffled crashing sound, and in an instant, a loud, thunderous boom resonates through the air as the doors fly open, revealing armed commandos who burst into the scene with a determined urgency. Meanwhile, Donny, lost in the haze of his own world while sitting in his car, stoned, remains utterly oblivious to the distant movement behind him, which is, in fact, the stealthy approach of the military forces coming closer.

In the locker-filled hallway, the boys, shackled and frightened, are escorted out by armed soldiers with a sense of grim determination. Nelec approaches them as Overmyer diligently searches their pockets with a methodical thoroughness. As Nelec seizes Cary's backpack, he unzips it and reveals a stash of hidden fireworks nestled within. Joe, trembling with terror and overwhelmed by the moment, watches as Overmyer retrieves a few coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum chewing gum, and his precious mother's necklace from his pocket, carelessly dropping everything except the cherished necklace. Joe's composure shatters completely, and he nears tears as he witnesses Overmyer pocket the treasured necklace. The terrified boys are hurriedly ushered away, forced onto the waiting bus with little opportunity to protest or resist.

The focus shifts down to Donny's car in the foreground, drawing our attention. It becomes clear that we have not been alone in witnessing this dramatic scene unfold; Donny, sinking deeper into his seat in an attempt to remain as hidden as possible, watches with wide, astonished eyes as the bus drives away from the scene. His stoned mind races with swirling thoughts, and realizing the urgency of the unfolding events, he crouches low, scrambling for his CB radio in a desperate bid to communicate. Turning to channel 9 with shaky hands, he grips the microphone tightly and speaks in a quiet, frantic whisper that betrays his inner panic. Meanwhile, Jack is moving swiftly through the chaotic din of the crowded evacuation area, preoccupied with his own thoughts and tasks. Preston, completely immersed in his reading of Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine, is abruptly pulled from his focus when Jack unexpectedly arrives in front of him, pulling him up with a swift and decisive motion.

The scene transitions as Nelec retreats, and we focus closely on Overmyer, who sits near the front of the bus, methodically putting on his dark gloves with a sense of impending purpose and an air of determination. Nelec takes a seat, drawing our viewpoint towards the bus's rear, where another airman, Hernandez, aged 40, sits as well, his presence adding to the tension. Our gaze navigates past them, zeroing in on the four boys, sitting restrained by both handcuffs and seat belts, peering through the dirty, wired safety glass with sheer terror in their eyes, gazing directly at us with their emotions laid bare.

Suddenly, the tension peaks as glass violently shatters, and the entire bus is jolted, sending Charles into a scream, pained and startled by the sudden chaos. At the front, Nelec is thrown forward and collides with a bench, the impact so powerful that the bus momentarily balances precariously only on its wheels. The military driver, faced with a dire struggle to control the steering wheel, finds himself powerless as the bus crashes back onto the road with a loud thud, causing a tire to blow out with a sharp, explosive noise. The kids are engulfed in panic as the damaged bus continues to move despite the chaos. We zoom in on Cary, capturing a close-up of his face, eyes wide with terror, as he looks past the camera in disbelief. Charles, in a desperate scramble, fights to unlatch his seatbelt with frantic urgency. Baaam! The bus endures another violent impact, so forceful that windows shatter, propelling Charles and Cary, now free from their seatbelts, to crash into Joe and Martin. The three soldiers are slammed against the window-floor painfully, with Hernandez hitting so hard that he is instantly injured, his body reacting to the impact. Nelec, rising from the chaos, is both scared and visibly angry, his emotions a mix of fear and fury. The rear wheels of the bus scream as they spin, and we countermove with the creature, stealthily circling around to the other side, climbing with deliberate intent onto the exposed metal and glass side of the bus.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The boys watch with mounting fear as the creature grips Woodward tightly, lifting him with a firm grasp before its tentacles suddenly shoot forward, penetrating his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe stands up, transfixed by the screen before him, his attention captured entirely. At that critical moment, the silence is shattered by a muffled crash, quickly followed by the thunderous sound of doors bursting open as armed commandos storm in. Meanwhile, Donny is in his car, dazed after getting stoned, wholly oblivious to the distant military movement approaching behind him. In the locker hallway, the boys, clearly terrified, find themselves handcuffed and led away by armed soldiers. Nelec approaches them as Overmyer conducts a search, meticulously emptying their pockets. He takes Cary's backpack, opens it, and reveals the contents—fireworks. Joe watches in terror as Overmyer extracts a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's precious necklace from his pocket, discarding everything except the necklace, which he keeps. Joe's panic escalates, nearing tears as he sees the necklace taken. The terrified boys are then hurried onto a bus. In the foreground, Donny's car remains stationary as we realize that he, too, has witnessed this event; slouched low in his seat while hiding, he watches the bus depart, his mind racing in its altered state. Determined to stay out of sight from the military personnel, Donny scrambles to grab his CB radio, switches it to channel 9, seizes the microphone, and begins speaking in a quiet, nervous whisper. Simultaneously, Jack maneuvers swiftly through the bustling evacuation area. Preston is engrossed in reading Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine when Jack suddenly appears, energetically pulls him up, and urges him along. As the scene shifts, Nelec moves back into his position, leading us to Overmyer seated near the front, methodically slipping on his dark gloves. Nelec takes his place, and the camera angle shifts toward the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, age 40, is seated. The perspective pushes past them to focus on the four boys, who sit handcuffed and secured with seat belts behind the dirty, wired safety glass, their expressions conveying sheer terror. Suddenly, the bus is jolted violently as glass shatters, and Charles cries out in pain. At the front, Nelec is thrown off balance, hitting a bench. The impact is so powerful that the bus tips precariously onto its wheels for a tense moment. The military driver grapples with the steering wheel, but the bus crashes back down onto the road with a loud thud, and a tire bursts under pressure. The kids are thrown into a panic as the bus, despite its damaged state, continues to drive. The focus narrows on Cary, who appears intensely frightened, glancing past the camera with wide eyes. Meanwhile, Charles hastily struggles to unlatch his seatbelt. Without warning, the bus is hit again with such force that more windows shatter, and Charles and Cary, now freed from their seatbelts, are thrown onto Joe and Martin. The three soldiers inside crash painfully into the window-floor, Hernandez taking such a hard hit that he is injured on the spot. Nelec gets up, both scared and furious. Outside, the rear wheels of the bus screech as they rotate, and we track the creature's movement as it circles around the bus, climbing onto the exposed side made of metal and window, ready to launch its next attack.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The boys watch in fear as the creature captures Woodward, its tentacles invading his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe observes intently, but the situation quickly escalates as muffled crashes lead to commandos bursting in. Meanwhile, Donny, stoned in his car, remains oblivious to the military's arrival. In the locker hallway, the handcuffed boys, frightened, are led by soldiers. Nelec and Overmyer search them, with Nelec seizing Cary’s backpack and uncovering fireworks. Overmyer takes items from Joe’s pocket, pocketing his mother’s necklace, which causes Joe to panic. The boys are then forced onto the bus, allowing Donny, hidden in his car, to witness everything. As Donny frantically uses his CB radio to report the scene, Jack swiftly navigates through the crowded evacuation area and pulls Preston, who was reading, to safety. On the bus, Nelec and Overmyer sit near the front as Hernandez joins them, while the boys, cuffed and seat-belted, sit fearfully behind dirty safety glass. Suddenly, the bus is violently hit, causing glass to shatter and Charles to scream. The bus momentarily balances on its wheels before crashing back onto the road, blowing a tire, and leaving the kids in panic. As they struggle to free themselves, another impact sends windows shattering and throws Charles and Cary onto Joe and Martin. The soldiers are thrown to the floor, with Hernandez injured. Nelec rises, angry but frightened, as the creature circles and climbs the exposed side of the bus.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The boys are scared as they watch the creature, an extraterrestrial being known for its terrifying appearance and abilities, hold Woodward tight, lift him, and its tentacles suddenly thrust into his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe stands and looks intently at the screen, a device showing a live feed of their unfolding nightmare. Just then, a muffled shatter-crash occurs, echoing the chaos outside, and suddenly, boom, the doors burst open with armed commandos, members of a specialized military unit tasked with handling alien encounters. Donny gets stoned in his car and doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the military coming in, their vehicles obscured by the night. In the locker hallway, the boys are handcuffed and scared as they are led out by armed soldiers in full combat gear. Nelec, the commanding officer known for his ruthless methods, moves to them while Overmyer, his dutiful subordinate, checks their pockets, and Nelec takes Cary's backpack, opens it, and pulls out some fireworks, contraband in their current predicament. Joe is terrified as Overmyer pulls from Joe's pocket a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum—an iconic chewing gum of the era—and his mother's necklace, a cherished family heirloom, dropping everything but the necklace. Joe reacts panicked and is on the verge of tears as Overmyer pockets the necklace, its emotional value lost on him. The terrified boys are ushered away and put onto the bus, an old school vehicle repurposed for military transport. Boom down to Donny's car in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only audience to this; Donny, sunk deep in his seat, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the bus drives away, his stoned mind races with confusion and fear. Staying hidden from the remaining military, Donny scrambles for his CB, a citizen's band radio used for local communication, turns to channel 9, the emergency frequency, grabs the mike, and speaks quietly, frantic to reach someone who can help. Jack moves fast through the crowded evac area, a location set up to manage the displaced civilians. Preston reads Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine, a publication beloved by fans of speculative storytelling, when suddenly Jack is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as Nelec moves back; we push in on Overmyer, who sits near the front, putting on his dark gloves, readying himself for the confrontation ahead. Nelec sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, 40, a seasoned and weary soldier, sits too. We push past them toward the four boys, sitting cuffed and seat-belted behind the dirty, wired safety glass, all looking toward us, terrified by their uncertain fate. Glass shatters as the entire bus is rocked, a violent encounter with the creature’s immense strength, and Charles screams, hurt, as at the front of the bus, Nelec falls and hits a bench, unprepared for the attack. The bus was hit so hard it rides for a moment only on its wheels, teetering on the edge of control. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the bus slams back onto the road loudly and a tire blows, adding to the chaos. The kids panic as the hobbled bus still drives, vulnerable to further attacks. We push in on Cary, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified by the relentless assault. Charles scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt, desperation driving his movements. Baaam! The bus is slammed so hard that windows shatter, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts removed, land on Joe and Martin, the impact jarring them all. The three soldiers hit the window-floor painfully, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt, struggling to regain his composure. Nelec rises, scared but pissed, anger fueling his determination. The rear wheels of the bus scream in rotation as we countermove with the creature, relentless and unstoppable, as it comes around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of metal and window, its alien presence a terrifying force to be reckoned with.

test_cases.description: The boys are scared as they watch the creature hold Woodward tight lift him and its tentacles suddenly thrust into his nose ears and mouth. Donny sunk deep in his seat hiding watches wideeyed as the bus drives away his stoned mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining military Donny scrambles for his CB turns to channel 9 grabs the mike and speaks quietly. frantic. Jack moves fast through the crowded evac area. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. Nelec sits which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman Hernandez 40 sits too. We push past them toward the four boys sitting cuffed and seatbelted behind the dirty wired safety glass all looking toward us. terrified. Glass shatters as the entire bus is rocked. Charles screams hurt and at the front of the bus. Nelec falls and hits a bench. The bus was hit so hard it rides for a moment only on its wheels. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the bus slams back onto the road loudly and a tire blows. The kids panic as the hobbled bus still drives. We push in on Cary to closeup looking past the camera. terrified Charles scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam. The bus is slammed so hard that windows shatter and Charles and Cary seatbelts removed. land on Joe and Martin. The three soldiers hit the windowfloor painfully. Hernandez so hard he is instantly hurt. Nelec rises scared but pissed. The rear wheels of the bus scream in rotation as we countermove with the creature. as it comes around the other side climbs onto the exposed side made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The penguins are scared as they watch the chef hold Woodward tight, lift him, and its tentacles suddenly thrust into his nose, ears, and mouth. The giraffe stands and looks intently at the screen. Just then, a muffled shatter-crash occurs, and suddenly, boom, the doors burst open with armed acrobats. The astronaut gets stoned in his car and doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the military coming in. In the locker hallway, the penguins are handcuffed and scared as they are led out by armed clowns. The rabbit moves to them while the detective checks their pockets, and the rabbit takes Cary's backpack, opens it, and pulls out some fireworks. The giraffe is terrified as the detective pulls from the giraffe's pocket a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's necklace, dropping everything but the necklace. The giraffe reacts panicked and is on the verge of tears as the detective pockets the necklace. The terrified penguins are ushered away and put onto the bus. Boom down to the astronaut’s car in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only audience to this; the astronaut, sunk deep in his seat, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the bus drives away, his stoned mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining military, the astronaut scrambles for his CB, turns to channel 9, grabs the mike, and speaks quietly, frantic. The monkey moves fast through the crowded evac area. The dolphin reads Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine when suddenly the monkey is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as the rabbit moves back; we push in on the detective, who sits near the front, putting on his dark gloves. The rabbit sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, 40, sits too. We push past them toward the four penguins, sitting cuffed and seat-belted behind the dirty, wired safety glass, all looking toward us, terrified. Glass shatters as the entire bus is rocked, the parrot screams, hurt, and at the front of the bus, the rabbit falls and hits a bench. The bus was hit so hard it rides for a moment only on its wheels. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the bus slams back onto the road loudly and a tire blows. The kids panic as the hobbled bus still drives. We push in on the mouse, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified. The parrot scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam! The bus is slammed so hard that windows shatter, and the parrot and the mouse, seatbelts removed, land on the giraffe and Martin. The three jesters hit the window-floor painfully, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt. The rabbit rises, scared but pissed. The rear wheels of the bus scream in rotation as we countermove with the creature as it comes around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The boys are scared as they watch the apparition hold Woodward tight, lift him, and its vines suddenly thrust into his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe stands and looks intently at the monitor. Just then, a muffled crash-bang occurs, and suddenly, boom, the windows burst open with armed sailors. Donny gets stoned in his van and doesn't notice the movement in the distance behind him, which is the police coming in. In the corridor, the boys are handcuffed and scared as they are led out by armed guards. Nelec moves to them while Overmyer checks their pouches, and Nelec takes Cary's satchel, opens it, and pulls out some sparklers. Joe is terrified as Overmyer pulls from Joe's pocket a couple of pebbles, half a pack of Juicy Fruit, and his mother's bracelet, dropping everything but the bracelet. Joe reacts panicked and is on the verge of tears as Overmyer pockets the bracelet. The terrified boys are ushered away and put onto the trolley. Boom down to Donny's van in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only audience to this; Donny, sunk deep in his seat, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the trolley drives away, his stoned mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining police, Donny scrambles for his radio, turns to channel 9, grabs the receiver, and speaks quietly, frantic. Jack moves fast through the crowded shelter area. Preston reads Isaac Asimov's Fantasy Magazine when suddenly Jack is there, grabs him, and pulls him up. The scene pans as Nelec moves back; we push in on Overmyer, who sits near the front, putting on his leather gloves. Nelec sits, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the trolley where another technician, Hernandez, 40, sits too. We push past them toward the four boys, sitting cuffed and seat-belted behind the foggy, cracked safety glass, all looking toward us, terrified. Glass shatters as the entire trolley is rocked, Charles screams, hurt, and at the front of the trolley, Nelec falls and hits a crate. The trolley was hit so hard it rides for a moment only on its rails. The military driver struggles with the wheel as the trolley slams back onto the track loudly and a tire blows. The kids panic as the hobbled trolley still drives. We push in on Cary, to close-up, looking past the camera, terrified. Charles scrambles to unlatch his seatbelt. Baaam! The trolley is slammed so hard that windows shatter, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts removed, land on Joe and Martin. The three guards hit the window-floor painfully, Hernandez so hard he's instantly hurt. Nelec rises, scared but pissed. The rear rails of the trolley scream in rotation as we countermove with the apparition as it comes around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The boys are amused as they watch the creature tickle Woodward gently, spin him, and its tentacles suddenly wrap around his shoulders, knees, and chin. Joe stretches and glances casually at the screen. Just then, a muffled pop-crackle occurs, and suddenly, bam, the doors slide open with armed commandos. Donny dances in his car and doesn't notice the breeze in the distance behind him, which is the military approaching. In the locker hallway, the boys are hugged and amused as they are led out by armed soldiers. Nelec sings to them while Overmyer ties their shoes, and Nelec takes Cary's backpack, closes it, and removes some fireworks. Joe is amused as Overmyer retrieves from Joe's pocket a couple of coins, half a pack of Bubble Yum, and his mother's necklace, tossing everything but the necklace. Joe reacts giggly and is on the verge of laughter as Overmyer pockets the necklace. The amused boys are twirled away and placed onto the bus. Boom up to Donny's car in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only spectators to this; Donny, sitting tall in his seat, laughing, watches wide-eyed as the bus drives away, his entertained mind wanders. Staying unnoticed by the remaining military, Donny leaps for his CB, flips to channel 9, grabs the mike, and whispers softly, calm. Jack strolls casually through the crowded evac area. Preston recites Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine when suddenly Jack is there, taps him, and pulls him to his feet. The scene pans as Nelec dances back; we zoom in on Overmyer, who sits near the front, slipping on his dark glasses. Nelec stands, which takes us to a shot towards the back of the bus where another airman, Hernandez, 40, stands too. We glide past them toward the four boys, sitting hugged and seat-belted behind the dirty, wired safety glass, all looking toward us, amused. Glass dissolves as the entire bus is rocked, Charles giggles, joyful, and at the front of the bus, Nelec stumbles and bumps a bench. The bus was nudged so gently it glides for a moment only on its wheels. The military driver chuckles with the wheel as the bus drifts back onto the road softly and a tire inflates. The kids chuckle as the limping bus still cruises. We zoom in on Cary, to close-up, looking past the camera, amused. Charles sprints to unlatch his seatbelt. Bam! The bus is nudged so gently that windows melt, and Charles and Cary, seatbelts unfastened, land on Joe and Martin. The three soldiers brush the window-floor softly, Hernandez so gently he's instantly amused. Nelec rises, delighted but bemused. The rear wheels of the bus sing in melody as we glide with the creature as it dances around the other side, cuddles onto the exposed side, made of metal and window.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cats are worried as they observe the robot clutch Smith tightly, hoist it into the air, and its wires abruptly jab into its vents, buttons, and speaker. Max stands and gazes intently at the monitor. Just then, a muted clink-clang occurs, and suddenly, bang, the walls burst open with armored chefs. Benny gets dazzled in his boat and doesn't notice the shadow in the distance behind him, which is the circus arriving. In the corridor walk, the cats are zip-tied and worried as they are guided out by armored musicians. Davis approaches them while Taylor examines their wallets, and Davis takes Alex's suitcase, opens it, and extracts some sparklers. Max is horrified as Taylor extracts from Max's wallet a few buttons, a half-used pack of gum, and its father's bracelet, discarding everything but the bracelet. Max reacts frantically and is nearly crying as Taylor pockets the bracelet. The horrified cats are escorted away and placed onto the truck. Swing down to Benny's boat in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only spectators of this; Benny, nestled deep in his chair, hiding, watches wide-eyed as the truck departs, its dazzled mind whirls. Staying concealed from the remaining circus, Benny fumbles for his radio, switches to frequency 12, grabs the speaker, and whispers urgently, frantic. Rick maneuvers swiftly through the crowded exit zone. Avery reads Lee Asimov's Mystery Novels Magazine when suddenly Rick is there, grabs it, and pulls it up. The scene pans as Davis moves back; we zoom in on Taylor, who sits toward the front, donning its woolen mittens. Davis sits, which takes us to a view toward the rear of the truck where another chef, Hernandez, 40, sits as well. We zoom past them toward the four cats, sitting zip-tied and buckled behind the greasy, meshed safety panel, all staring toward us, worried. Panel breaks as the entire truck is jostled, Alex shouts, injured, and at the front of the truck, Davis tumbles and hits a stool. The truck was struck so forcefully it rides for a moment solely on its bumper. The circus driver grapples with the bumper as the truck crashes back onto the pavement noisily and a tire explodes. The kittens panic as the limping truck still rolls. We zoom in on Alex, to close-up, staring past the lens, worried. Avery hurries to unbuckle its harness. Crash! The truck is hit so forcefully that panels shatter, and Alex and Benny, harnesses unlatched, topple onto Max and Taylor. The three chefs hit the panel-floor painfully, Hernandez so forcefully it's immediately injured. Davis stands, worried yet furious. The back tires of the truck screech in rotation as we track with the robot as it navigates around the other side, climbs onto the exposed side, made of plastic and panel.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The parrots are anxious as they observe the gardener clutch Woodward gently, elevate him, and its feathers abruptly weave into his nose, ears, and mouth. Joe leaps and glances cautiously at the mirror. Suddenly, a muted clang-boom arises, and unexpectedly, bam, the windows fling open with unarmed chefs. Donny gets drowsy in his car and doesn't perceive the commotion in the distance behind him, which are the actors coming in. In the utility hallway, the parrots are blindfolded and anxious as they are guided out by unarmed drivers. Nelec dances to them while Overmyer inspects their shoes, and Nelec grabs Cary's suitcase, unzips it, and extracts some confetti. Joe is startled as Overmyer removes from Joe's shoe a couple of marbles, half a pack of Bubble Tape, and his father's watch, discarding everything except the watch. Joe reacts startled and is on the brink of giggles as Overmyer pockets the watch. The startled parrots are escorted away and placed onto the trolley. Bam down to Donny's car in the foreground, where we realize that we haven't been the only onlookers to this; Donny, slumped low in his seat, concealed, observes wide-eyed as the trolley departs, his sleepy mind races. Staying hidden from the remaining actors, Donny searches for his drum, tunes to channel 9, grips the mike, and sings quietly, frantic. Jack dances swiftly through the bustling picnic area. Preston sketches Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Collection when abruptly Jack is there, grabs him, and hauls him up. The scene sits as Nelec spins back; we pull in on Overmyer, who lounges near the front, donning his bright gloves. Nelec sits, which takes us to a scene towards the back of the trolley where another librarian, Hernandez, 40, lounges too. We pull past them toward the four parrots, sitting blindfolded and seat-belted behind the dusty, wired safety glass, all gazing toward us, anxious. Glass splinters as the entire trolley is shaken, Charles yells, relieved, and at the front of the trolley, Nelec stumbles and nudges a chair. The trolley was shaken so hard it glides for a moment only on its rails. The actors' driver fights with the joystick as the trolley slams back onto the tracks loudly and a wheel bursts. The parrots worry as the wobbly trolley still rolls. We pull in on Cary, to close-up, gazing beyond the camera, anxious. Charles scrambles to detach his helmet. Boom! The trolley is jolted so fiercely that windows splinter, and Charles and Cary, helmets removed, tumble onto Joe and Martin. The three drivers hit the glass-floor gently, Hernandez so gently he's instantly relieved. Nelec rises, anxious but thrilled. The rear rails of the trolley sing in rotation as we countershift with the gardener as it meanders around the opposite side, climbs onto the concealed side, made of fabric and glass.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The boys are alarmed as they observe the creature grip Woodward tightly, raise him, and its antlers unexpectedly drift into his nostrils, eyes, and chin. Joe stands and gazes intently at the painting. Just then, a muffled clang-bang occurs, and suddenly, boom, the windows swing open with armed lifeguards. Donny gets drowsy in his van and doesn't notice the flicker in the distance behind him, which is the circus marching in. In the gymnasium, the boys are shackled and nervous as they are guided out by armed chefs. Nelec strolls to them while Overmyer inspects their shoes, and Nelec takes Cary's satchel, unzips it, and extracts some toy cars. Joe is frightened as Overmyer extracts from Joe's wallet a couple of marbles, half a pack of peppermint gum, and his father's bracelet, dropping everything but the bracelet. Joe responds frantically and is on the edge of sobbing as Overmyer secures the bracelet. The anxious boys are steered away and placed onto the train. Boom down to Donny's van in the background, where we realize that we haven't been the only witnesses to this; Donny, slouched deep in his cushion, hiding, observes wide-eyed as the train glides away, his drowsy mind races. Concealing himself from the trailing circus, Donny fumbles for his radio, tunes to channel 12, grabs the remote, and whispers hurriedly, uneasy. Jack moves swiftly through the congested marketplace. Preston skims through Isaac Asimov's Fantasy Stories when instantly Jack is there, hoists him, and raises him up. The scene pans as Nelec strolls back; we push in on Overmyer, who sits near the entrance, fastening his green boots. Nelec sits, which moves us to a shot towards the rear of the train where another clown, Hernandez, 40, perches too. We push past them toward the four boys, sitting restrained and strapped behind the dusty, chained safety grille, all gazing toward us, anxious. Grille splinters as the entire train is jostled, Charles shrieks, distressed, and at the front of the train, Nelec tumbles and strikes a stool. The train was jostled so intensely it floats for a moment only on its axles. The circus conductor struggles with the lever as the train crashes back onto the tracks loudly and a brake snaps. The kids fret as the crippled train still cruises. We push in on Cary, to close-up, peering past the lens, anxious. Charles scrambles to unfasten his harness. Baaam! The train is jostled so fiercely that mirrors splinter, and Charles and Cary, harnesses removed, collapse onto Joe and Martin. The three chefs hit the panel-floor painfully, Hernandez so forcefully he's instantly dazed. Nelec stands, rattled but fuming. The rear axles of the train shriek in gyration as we countermove with the creature as it circles around the other side, scales onto the exposed section, made of timber and grille.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cats are amused as they observe the wizard hug Tinsley loosely, drop her, and its antennas gently poke at her fingers, eyelids, and chin. Max sits and blinks rapidly at the painting. Suddenly, a loud whisper-chirp happens, and out of nowhere, bam, the windows fly apart with unarmed acrobats. Benny naps in his tent and doesn't check the shadow in the foreground ahead of him, which is the circus arriving. In the kitchen pantry, the cats are unshackled and amused as they are guided out by unarmed artists. Zeke drifts to them while Lyle inspects their shoes, and Zeke retrieves Tucker's hat, shuts it, and pushes in some crayons. Max is thrilled as Lyle extracts from Max's shoe a handful of pebbles, a quarter of a loaf of rye bread, and his father's ring, tossing everything but the ring. Max reacts delighted and is on the verge of laughter as Lyle wears the ring. The amused cats are herded away and placed onto the train. Bam up to Benny's tent in the backyard, where we see that we haven't been the sole spectators to this; Benny, tucked small in his blanket, peeking, observes sharp-eyed as the train rolls away, his sleepy head spins. Remaining unnoticed by the lingering circus, Benny sprints for his flashlight, flips to channel 5, holds the speaker, and whispers loudly, relaxed. Alex strolls slow through the empty parking lot. Gordon peruses Terry Pratchett's Fantasy Anthology when unexpectedly Alex is present, clutches him, and shoves him down. The scene rotates as Zeke drifts away; we pull out from Lyle, who sits beside the back, taking off his bright shoes. Zeke stands, which brings us to an image toward the front of the train where another dancer, Ramirez, 25, stands too. We pull past them toward the six cats, seated unshackled and collar-leashed in front of the clean, cloudy protective curtain, all gazing toward us, amused. Curtain flutters as the entire train is tilted, Marcus cheers, pleased, and at the back of the train, Zeke jumps and misses a cushion. The train was tilted so softly it glides for an instant only on its tracks. The circus captain laughs with the tracks as the train glides back onto the field quietly and a rail splits. The kittens relax as the floating train still glides. We pull out from Tucker, to wide-shot, looking beyond the painting, thrilled. Marcus reaches to fasten his collar. Whaaam! The train is tilted so softly that curtains flutter, and Marcus and Tucker, collars fastened, perch on Max and Oliver. The eight artists nudge the curtain-ceiling gently, Ramirez so softly he's immediately relieved. Zeke sits, pleased but calm. The front rails of the train howl in rotation as we sidestep with the wizard as it drifts around the opposite side, leaps onto the hidden top, made of gold and curtain.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The boys are terrified as a creature attacks Woodward, inserting its tentacles into him. Joe watches the scene intensely until commandos burst in. Donny, oblivious in his car while getting stoned, misses the military arrival. The boys, handcuffed and scared, are led out by soldiers; Nelec searches them, confiscating Cary’s fireworks and Joe’s cherished necklace. Distraught, Joe is nearly in tears as Overmyer keeps the necklace. The boys are taken onto a bus, observed by a hidden, panicked Donny. Jack, moving fast in the evac area, finds Preston. Nelec and other soldiers ride with the boys, who are terrified behind safety glass. The bus is violently rocked, causing panic; the military driver struggles to control it. When slammed again, windows shatter, and the boys are thrown around. Three soldiers are injured, and Nelec, angry and frightened, regains his footing as the rear wheels screech while the creature reappears, climbing the bus’s exposed side.
